0: In recent years, there has been a growing debate over whether vaccinations should be mandatory for children attending public schools. Proponents argue that mandatory vaccinations protect public health by ensuring herd immunity and preventing outbreaks of infectious diseases. Opponents claim that mandatory vaccinations infringe on personal freedoms and parental rights.
